where-you-go.context: Ruth's declaration of loyalty to Naomi
where-you-go.hebrew: כִּי אֶל־אֲשֶׁר תֵּלְכִי אֵלֵךְ וּבַאֲשֶׁר תָּלִינִי אָלִין עַמֵּךְ עַמִּי וֵאלֹהַיִךְ אֱלֹהָי
where-you-go.english: Wherever you go, I will go; wherever you lodge, I will lodge; your people shall be my people, and your God my God

death-alone-parts.english: Where you die, I will die, and there I will be buried

left-everything.hebrew: וַתַּעַזְבִי אָבִיךְ וְאִמֵּךְ וְאֶרֶץ מוֹלַדְתֵּךְ וַתֵּלְכִי אֶל־עַם אֲשֶׁר לֹא־יָדַעַתְּ
left-everything.english: You left your father and mother and the land of your birth and came to a people you had not known

under-his-wings.hebrew: יְשַׁלֵּם יְהוָה פָּעֳלֵךְ וּתְהִי מַשְׂכֻּרְתֵּךְ שְׁלֵמָה מֵעִם יְהוָה אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר־בָּאת לַחֲסוֹת תַּחַת־כְּנָפָיו
under-his-wings.english: May you have a full recompense from the Lord, under whose wings you have sought refuge

gleaning-fields.english: Let me go to the field and glean among the ears of grain
